intro: Echinodorus subulatus, commonly known as the Needle-leaf Waterweed, is a popular aquatic plant native to South America. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically 10–30 cm long and have a pointed tip, giving it its common name. This plant thrives in freshwater environments and is often used in aquariums due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal. It prefers moderate to high light levels and can grow in a variety of water conditions. Echinodorus subulatus is known for its ability to provide shelter for aquatic life and help maintain water quality by absorbing nutrients.
